summary: This document appears to be a summary of a WebEx meeting or interview conducted on November 19, 2021, likely with a staff member from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence. The interviewee describes the frequent, non-professional massages Epstein received from young females, characterized as 'school girls' of high school age, and details the process of their arrival and entry into the home.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation / Recipient of massages
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' in the document. The interviewee states Epstein received between 2 and 4 massages every day when he was in Palm Beach, arranged by his assistants, from young females described as 'school girls'.

events.title: WebEx Interview Meeting
events.description: A meeting or interview conducted via WebEx where an individual (likely a staff member) was asked about legal counsel and then provided detailed information about the massage appointments for Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach house.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein received between 2 and 4 massages every day when he was in Palm Beach.
The massages were arranged by Epstein's assistants, who would call to notify that 'people were coming at certain time to give JE massages.'
The individuals giving massages were female, described as young 'school girls' of high school age (under 20, not professional masseuses), and wore casual clothes.
The interviewee's impression was that 'all the girls coming to give massages were "school girls"' and that they would sometimes talk about school, soccer games, and classes.

Multiple girls would sometimes arrive together, and the interviewee recalls one instance where two girls who seemed like friends came, with one waiting in the kitchen while the other went upstairs for the massage.
